children.subject: if you might want to take cs 160, I recommend enrolling; there is only one spot left.

history.content:
Both my freshman and sophomore summers, I took classes here in Berkeley. My freshman year, I also lab assisted for CS61A, and in my sophomore year, I worked in a research group. I found these experiences rewarding. 

IMO, if you are even considering taking a class, sign up. That way you at least can be enrolled, and WCS, you pay $10 at the end to drop summer registration.

____


There are still a lot of companies still recruiting for interns right now so I wouldn't give up hope just yet! Unless you're completely set on not doing internships this summer, then classes would be a good idea. If you take just 1 or 2 classes over the summer, I'm confident that you'll still have some time to work on small side projects as well. Good luck!

Both my freshman and sophomore summers, I took classes here in Berkeley. My freshman year, I also lab assisted for CS61A, and in my sophomore year, I worked in a research group. I found these experiences rewarding. 

IMO, if you are even considering taking a class, sign up. That way you at least can be enrolled, and WCS, you pay $10 at the end to drop summer registration.
Should I just work on side projects? I'm tempted to take a 160 over the summer along with something light. Not sure yet, any advice to add to my resume?
history.subject: What to do with summer if I have no internship?
